name: European Chamber of Commerce in Myanmar
memberOrga:
BMW/ Prestige Automobiles, Accor Hotel (Bangkok), Elegant Supreme, Heineken Myanmar/ APB Alliance Brewery, Roland Berger Company Ltd, Melia Hotel Yangon, Global Technology Group, Novotel Hotels & Resorts (Yangon Max), Friesland Campina, IVECO, De Heus Myanmar, Carlsberg, Sanofi, Luther Law Firm, Bureau Veritas, Scania/ Octagon Automobile, Haskoning DHV Myanmar Co.,Ltd, Exera, Philips, Kempinski Hotel, CMI  - Cockerill Maintenance & Ingénierie, Schneider Electric, Archetype, DFDL, Zuelling Pharma, British American Tobacco, Pernod Ricard, Dulwich College, Moet Hennessy, DKSH, Amava, VOLVO, Casico, Maersk
H&M, Telenor, Nordic Technology Group, Jotun Myanmar, Fresh Studio, C&A Sourcing International Myanmar, Philip Morris Asia Limited, Sika Myanmar Limited, Yoma German Motors Ltd  (Volkswagen), Cycles & Carriage Automobile Myanmar, Dentons Myanmar Ltd, Control Union, Period, Ricard, Bel Ga Myanmar, Zaya & Association, AgriTech Global (AgriM), Siemens, Diageo, BSK Fashion, Unilever.
goal:
The European Chamber of Commerce in Myanmar – EuroCham Myanmar-, funded by the European Union, was formally launched in Yangon in December 2014. The creation of a European Chamber of Commerce in Myanmar reinforces the mutually beneficial relationship between the EU and the Republic of the Union of Myanmar. The European Union was in fact one of the first actors to respond to the country's political opening, suspending in April 2012 its restrictive measures except for the arms embargo.
EuroCham Myanmar serves as the voice of European business in Myanmar. Its main mission is to advocate member interests with organisations in Myanmar, the ASEAN region and the EU.
EuroCham seeks to offer on the ground assistance to European businesses interested in commercial endeavours in Myanmar – be it in the form of advocacy, services, studies, or other related activities.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Consumers, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Activities related to the promotion of trade and investment with Myanmar. This scope covers the related activities undertaken with DG Trade, and the GSP agreement and its possible evolutions.
